view

Class ParticipantsBean

  • java.lang.Object
    • view.ParticipantsBean
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class ParticipantsBean
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Handles all the presentation of participants in a data table, editing removing, filtering and ordering. It also has an internal cache to minimize queries to the database. Since it uses a view scope, the same user can have more than one web browser tabs and apply different filters to the data. Depending on the credentials of the users they can edit or not the entries.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getStatisticCountry

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getStatisticCountry()
        Returns:

      • isEditing

        public boolean isEditing(ParticipantEntity part)
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if part is currently being edited, otherwise false.

      • edit

        public void edit(ParticipantEntity part)
        Updates the internal cache and persist the changes. Everything is handled by a transaction using optimistic locking. If there is a problem (like lost update), the entity affected is recovered querying it from the persistence system.
        Parameters:
        part -

      • remove
